title: Effects of ONO-2506PO in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to establish the presence of an effect of treatment with ONO-2506PO in patients with Alzheimer's Disease, based upon cognitive and global scales.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial title and brief summary state the intervention is ONO-2506PO and the purpose is to assess its effect on cognition and global scales in Alzheimer’s disease, i.e., a treatment trial. citeturn0search0.

Act: ONO-2506 is the small molecule arundic acid (chemical: (R)-(-)-2-propyloctanoic acid). Preclinical and clinical-trial registry entries identify ONO-2506/ arundic acid as the investigational drug in this Phase 2 AD study. citeturn0search0turn0search5.

Act (mechanism): Arundic acid (ONO-2506) modulates astrocytic activation by inhibiting synthesis/overproduction of the astrocyte-derived protein S100B and thereby reduces detrimental astrocytic responses in models of brain injury; multiple preclinical publications describe this glial-targeting/neuroprotective mechanism. citeturn0search5turn0search3.

Act (additional evidence): Other preclinical studies show ONO-2506 alters gliotransmission and has neuroprotective/antiseizure effects consistent with a glial-targeting small molecule rather than a biologic. citeturn0search1.

Reflect (classification): Because ONO-2506 is a small-molecule drug (arundic acid) whose reported mechanism is modulation of astrocyte biology/S100B (a pathophysiologic process linked to CNS injury and proposed Alzheimer's mechanisms), the appropriate category is 'disease-targeted small molecule' — it targets disease-related pathology (astrocytic activation) rather than acting purely as a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or a neuropsychiatric treatment. The trial’s primary outcomes (cognitive and global scales) reflect clinical endpoints, but the drug’s mechanism supports disease-targeted classification. citeturn0search5turn0search0.

Web-search results (sources used): NCT registry entry for this trial listing ONO-2506PO (arundic acid) and trial details. citeturn0search0; PubMed / article describing arundic acid inhibiting S100B and reducing astrocytic activation and brain injury. citeturn0search5turn0search3; Preclinical study showing ONO-2506 effects on gliotransmission and inhibitory neurotransmitter release. citeturn0search1.

Notes / ambiguity: The registry text is brief and primary outcomes are clinical (cognition/global). If one judged purely from endpoints (cognitive improvement) without mechanism information, the drug might be interpreted as a cognitive enhancer; however, the identified mechanism (astrocyte/S100B modulation) supports classification as a disease-targeted small molecule. If you want, I can fetch the full Phase 2 protocol or publication (if any) to confirm dosing/regimen and whether a placebo arm was used. citeturn0search0.
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug ONO-2506 (arundic acid) is described and reported in the literature to modulate astrocyte activation by inhibiting synthesis/release of the astrocyte-derived protein S100B and to reduce downstream neuroinflammatory signaling — a glia-mediated inflammatory mechanism rather than an amyloid/tau or purely symptomatic target. citeturn0search3turn0search6

Act: Extracted details from the trial description and literature: drug = ONO-2506 (arundic acid), a disease‑targeted small molecule; mechanism = inhibition of astrocytic S100B synthesis and modulation of reactive astrocytosis with anti‑inflammatory/neuroprotective effects; clinical record = Phase 2 trial ONO-2506PO in Alzheimer’s disease (registry entry). citeturn0search3turn1search5

Reflect: Classification check against CADRO: modulation of astrocyte activation and reduction of S100B-mediated neuroinflammatory signaling maps best to CADRO category F) Inflammation (neuroinflammation / glial-mediated immune processes). The intervention is not primarily targeting amyloid, tau, ApoE/lipids, synaptic receptors, or purely symptomatic neurotransmission, nor is it clearly multi-target or non-therapeutic, so F is the most specific fit. citeturn0search5turn0search6

Web search results (key sources used): 1) Clinical trial registry entry for "Effects of ONO-2506PO in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease" (Phase 2 ONO-2506PO / NCT record). citeturn1search5 2) Arundic acid (ONO-2506) inhibits astrocytic overproduction of S100B and ameliorates ischemic/neuronal injury. citeturn0search3 3) Preclinical studies showing ONO-2506 modulates astrocytic activation, mitigates S100B-related pathology and neuroinflammation (including links to apoE4 effects and ICH/epilepsy models). citeturn0search5turn0search6
